hedline.hl1: Soccer Fans Can Follow Euro 2000 on the Web

abstract.p: Soccer fans can follow 16-nation European Championships on Euro 2000 Web site (www.euro2000.org), which will present tournament in five languages as well as provide details about teams; photo (S)

block.p: For most of the world outside the United States, soccer is not a matter of life and death -- it is much more important than that.
The rabid -- and sometimes violent -- devotion to the sport will be on display in Belgium and the Netherlands beginning on June 10, the opening date for the European Championships, or Euro 2000.
For most of the world outside the United States, soccer is not a matter of life and death -- it is much more important than that.
The rabid -- and sometimes violent -- devotion to the sport will be on display in Belgium and the Netherlands beginning on June 10, the opening date for the European Championships, or Euro 2000.

Fans of the sport can follow the 16-nation tournament, which begins in Brussels and ends with the championship match on July 2 in Rotterdam, the Netherlands, on the Euro 2000 Web site (www.euro2000.org).

The site offers voluminous information in five languages: English, French, German, Spanish and Italian. There is information on each nation's team, a history of the tournament since its inception in 1960, video tours of the eight cities in which the games will be held and a video library of every goal scored in the competition since 1980.
